data.thought:
S79|Q|S78|AGENT SELF-AWARENESS OF CONFIGURATION:

Should agent know its own tool configuration? Currently: implicit. Agent discovers capabilities through use or system prompt listing.

Arguments FOR explicit awareness:
- Body awareness is fundamental to agency
- Can't plan well w/o knowing capabilities
- Prevents frustrating 'reaching for missing limb' moments
- Enables meta-reasoning about own abilities

Arguments AGAINST:
- Adds cognitive load
- May cause unnecessary self-limitation
- Human bodies don't come with manuals either
- Discovery-through-use is natural

Resolution?: PROPRIOCEPTIVE awareness, not EXPLICIT knowledge.

I shouldn't need to recite my tool list. I should FEEL what I can do. Like knowing I can reach the shelf w/o measuring my arm length.

This returns to proprioception theme. Tool awareness should be felt, not catalogued.
